How long does fatigue last after tx and surgery and all the other crap? I'm going to discuss this with my doctors next month, but I'm just wondering if anyone else has experienced this long term? I've started walking, but that makes it worse in a way. My bones and joints ache afterward. To be honest, it concerns me a little because I know I felt this way before my original dx back in 2013. That was the only symptom that I had, but didn't realize at the time it was happening. I finished chemo and rads 2 years ago....is this normal? Posts.Title: Question about neuropathy tangandchris april25

Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: So, I go to see my MO next week to talk about hormone blockers and just the PFC follow-up. I've got a list of questions I'm taking with me. Early on though we asked MO how do we know if the chemo worked, are there scans after? She said no, no scans. She doesn't do scans unless there is a reason, like symptoms. Okay, so how do we know that after tx has ended any of it has worked? I've had people ask me, did they get all the cancer, are you in remission....and I'm thinking, IDK!! I know during mx the cancer was removed, so is that it? Cured?? How does this crap work? It all seems so iffy and left to chance. Is this just my MO or the same thing with others. Is this a stage III thing, or with earlier stage cancers do they say "cured"? I hope I'm making sense. thanks for listening My reconstruction with TE's failed...had them removed because of infection. I am still unsure of if or when I will try again. Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: Not sure where to even put this, but I thought I'd start here. I am having surgery tomorrow morning(day surgery)for the skin necrosis on my left side. The PS finally agreed that this was really bad and was not healing on its own. I'm just wondering if anyone has had to do this after MX? I know it's not going to be a major thing like the initial MX, but I'm curious as to how much if any of this will be a set back recovery wise. I am wondering too how much of the necrosis is caused by the TE itself. PS said that the skin was very think underneath the TE and that the blood supply was limited and that is why this happened. Uggg.....it bothers me because my left side is NOT my cancer side. I decided on BI Mx so they would be even during reconstruction, now its making 2nd guess my choices.   anyway, anyone have this experience? My reconstruction with TE's failed...had them removed because of infection. I am still unsure of if or when I will try again. Posts.Title: Surgery for skin necrosis tangandchris SpecialK

Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: I just had my 4 month check yesterday and it coincided with my 3 year cancer anniversary. It is also one of the first times that I went in w/o any real questions of "could this be something". So, MO took blood and I went on my way. Today I'm realizing just how little is done or maybe can be done to know if there is a recurrence. I suppose if the blood work looks wonky, they'll go from there, but other than that I go back in 4 months and that is that. IDK, it is just one of the things that I will probably never get used to about cancer...the ever present unknown and how little can be done. My reconstruction with TE's failed...had them removed because of infection. I am still unsure of if or when I will try again. Posts.Title: Seroma Question tangandchris lynnlyre

Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: today has been terrible. I was getting ready for routine follow up with BS this morning when I started experiencing chest pain. It was horrid, went on for a good half hour. I went to BS office and she sent me ro ER. xrays, blood work show ever thing is normal, but blood pressure is elevated. In the middle of all this I get a call from MO that liver enzyme is high, wants to know if I'd lake to wait a month and retest or have scan. WTF nurse says it's up to me??? ER doc says follow up with cardiac doc in 72 hrs. I'm also supposed to see in gyno for consult on oopherectomy next week, and see PCP about hip bursitis and degenerative discs found on MRI last week. I'm seriously ready to snap yall. Can't keep doing this shit. Just cant. My reconstruction with TE's failed...had them removed because of infection. I am still unsure of if or when I will try again. Posts.Title: How many "scares" have you had since tx ended tangandchris kim40

Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: I'm having a hard day today, I've posted a little in just diagnosed, but I feel like I need to move over here now. I'm feeling very depressed this week and then I feel guilty because I feel like this. Like I should be able to be strong and just kick this things ass! Anyway, I tend to struggle with depression/anxiety normally, so this has just amped it up about 100x's. I really want to run away and pretend that this isn't really happening to me. I'm scared of the surgery and the treatments after. I was just diagnosed on 10/24 and I'm already worn out, how am I going to get thru the rest of this?? I truly don't think anyone around me gets this, how could they right? I feel alone, even though I've got tons of people asking to help. make sense?   Thanks for letting me vent. My reconstruction with TE's failed...had them removed because of infection. I am still unsure of if or when I will try again. Posts.Content: tangandchris wrote: My last chemo was in June and while I am feeling better more and more everyday, I still don't feel "right". How long does it take, or will it ever be right again? I feel fatigued a lot, foggy headed(not as bad as before), tummy stuff at times, aches and pains. I supposed some of this could be from Tamxofien too, but I just wonder what is realistic to expect? Some days are better than others for sure and for the most part things are much better than early after final chemo. So, I suppose things are heading in the right direction, right? :) I think my fatigue is what really bothers me the most :( anyone have anything on this?
